newsitem.title: NEW ZEALAND: DB to expand Heineken production by 40 pct.
newsitem.headline: DB to expand Heineken production by 40 pct.

text.p: DB Group Ltd said on Wednesday it would spend NZ$4.66 million on expansion of its Heineken fermenting and lagering capacity at its Waitemata brewery.
DB managing director Erik Kortals Altes said the expenditure was required two years ahead of the original plan due to continued strong demand for Heineken, which is brewed under licence.
Kortals Altes said Heineken's rapid growth had occasionally left DB out of stock but the investment would ensure availability in the summer peak period and beyond.
DB spent more than NZ$11 million to upgrade its facilities for batch-brewed Heineken in 1994 and production started in October that year.
DB is majority owned by Asia Pacific Breweries Ltd, a joint venture between Heineken NV and Frazer and Neave Ltd.
